H0.text: Hydroelectric power is a technology that helps a power company use renewable energy for the production of electricity.

H1.text: Nuclear power plants help a power company use renewable energy for the production of electricity.

H2.text: Natural gas generators help a power company use renewable energy for the production of electricity.

H3.text: Coal-fired power plants help a power company use renewable energy for the production of electricity.

A4.text: Hydroelectricity provides large amounts of low-carbon electricity on demand, making it a key element for creating secure and clean electricity supply systems.

A5.text: Hydropower supplies 15% of the world's electricity, almost 4,210 TWh in 2023, which is more than all other renewable sources combined and also more than nuclear power.
